author: Staff Reporter
text:
Collector K. Veera Raghava Rao commissioned CT Scan and digital X-ray facilities, established at a cost of Rs. 80 lakh, at the Government Headquarters Hospital in Usilampatti on Thursday.

He said that the new facilities would obviate the need for people in Usilampatti and surrounding areas to go all the way to Government Rajaji Hospital in Madurai. Heeding to the request by hospital authorities and public to set up a dialysis unit, the Collector said that Rs. 52 lakh would be immediately released from the funds of district administration and assured that the unit would be set up by this month-end itself.

He said that Rs. 70,000 would be sanctioned for setting up a water purification unit to augment drinking water supply at the hospital. Mr. Rao assured to address demands of the public and Usilampatti MLA P.V. Kathiravan who was present at the function.

The demands included mitigating water scarcity in several villages near Usilampatti and staff quarters for doctors, nurses and other staff of Usilampatti GH.
title: GH gets digital X-ray, CT scan facilities
